description:
Join over 500 parents who have signed up for the course!

As all the kids line up to go to school, your child turns to you and says, "I don't want to take the bus. My stomach hurts. Please don't make me go." You cringe and think, Here we go again. What should be a simple morning routine explodes into a daunting challenge.

If this sounds familiar, you are not alone. It hurts to watch your child worry over situations that, frankly, don't seem that scary. Here's the thing: To your child's mind, these situations are genuinely threatening. And even perceived threats can create a real nervous system response. We call this response anxiety and I know it well.

I'd spent the better part of my childhood covering up a persistent, overwhelming feeling of worry until, finally, in my early twenties, I decided to seek out a solution. What I've learned over the last two decades is that while there is no one-size-fits-all solution for anxiety, there are a plethora of great research-based techniques that can help manage it -- many of which are simple to learn. This course provides 9 actionable, practical, research inspired ideas that parents of anxious children can try right away.

A broad overview of the awesome stuff in the course:

  • 9 actionable techniques. You get 9 real, actionable ideas I've tested with many families to help kids conquer anxiety. You can try these starting today.
  • The secret sauce. I teach you; you teach your kids. How? This course is packed with teaching tools including animations, worksheets, and visuals to share directly with kids.
  • The ultimate goal. Your children can use these resilience skills on their own (WOOHOO!). And as a parent, you will no longer feel helpless when it comes to helping end their suffering. You will begin to thrive again as a family.

The 9 research-based techniques we cover:

  1. Thinking style: The best thinking style to overcome anxiety will be revealed.
  2. Shades of grey: Eliminate the black & white thinking style associated with anxiety.
  3. What ifs: Transform all those 'what if' questions about the future.
  4. Sleep: A 1-minute mindfulness exercise that will help your child get good rest.
  5. Relaxation: Relieve the nervous system in the throes of anxiety.
  6. Self-compassion: Nurture self-compassion through meditation.
  7. Body to mind: Teach your body to communicate to your mind.
  8. Mastery: Learn one skill to master all the others and boost resilience.
  9. Well-being: Practice holistic well-being by uncovering your child's superpowers.

Let's do this together!
title: 9 Powerful Techniques for Every Parent with An Anxious Child
